member.name: T:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue
member.summary: To offload work to a background thread and keeping that work in a synchronized order.

member.name: E:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue.OnWorkItemProcessed
member.summary: Invoked if an enqueued work item (function) was invoked successfully or unsuccessfully.

member.name: F:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue._processWorkQueueWaitHandle
member.summary: If this is set all items in the work queue will be processed, except if this processing is paused.

member.name: F:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue._continueWaitHandle
member.summary: Used for pausing and continuing processing the work queue.

member.name: F:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue._idleWaitHandle
member.summary: Used for pausing and continuing processing the work queue.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue.#ctor
member.summary: To offload work to a background thread and keeping that work in a synchronized order.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used.

summary.para: Releases all resources used.
Waits the given timeout before disposing (0 is acceptable, , smaller than 0 is indefinetly), if the work is not done it will be aborted.
Pauses the processing of the work queue and blocks until the processing is effectively paused.
Continue this processing calling 'ContinueProcessingWorkQueue()'.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue.ContinueProcessingWorkQueue
member.summary: Resumes the processing of the work queue.

summary.para: Adds a delegate on the work queue, that work queue is processed by a background thread, threadsafe.
The delegates on that queue are invoked in a synchronized order.
Define your delegate like so:
delegate T del(T, out T); (Action or Func is also possible.)
then pass your function using this signature:
The return type may be void and args are not obligatory.
Make sure you provide the right amount of args, even if it are out parameters (yes that is possible too).

member.name: M:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue.Flush
member.summary: Wait untill all work queue items are processed.

member.name: T:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue.OnWorkItemProcessedEventArgs
member.summary: The result of a called function or the exception thrown.

member.name: F:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue.OnWorkItemProcessedEventArgs.Parameters
member.summary: Out parameters are stored here too.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.BackgroundWorkQueue.OnWorkItemProcessedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Delegate,System.Object[],System.Object,System.Exception)
member.summary: The result of a called function or the exception thrown.

summary.para: A C# .net v4(.#) compiler unit.
For references there is linked in Application.StartupPath. Additional paths can be configured in the app.config like so:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<configuration>
<runtime>
<assemblyBinding xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1">
<probing privatePath="subfolder1;subfolder2"/>
</assemblyBinding>
</runtime>
</configuration>
A C# .net v4(.#) compiler unit.
For references there is linked in Application.StartupPath. Additional paths can be configured in the app.config like so:
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<configuration>
<runtime>
<assemblyBinding xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1">
<probing privatePath="subfolder1;subfolder2"/>
</assemblyBinding>
</runtime>
</configuration>

member.name: M:RandomUtils.CompilerUnit.Compile(System.String,System.Boolean,System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerResults@)
member.summary: A source should have 1 commented line with the dll references sepparated by a semicolon. eg: "// dllreferences: myDll.dll;myOtherDll.dll", empty entries are removed.
member.param: A piece of code (one or multiple classes) to be compiled into an assembly.
For compiling with an attached debugger. Compile warnings are not threated as errros.
member.returns: Null if not compiled. FS exceptions are thrown up.

For compiling with an attached debugger. Compile warnings are not threated as errros.
member.returns: Null if not compiled. FS exceptions are thrown up.

summary.para: This class contains extra functionality upon FindAndReplace for searching a given text. For instance: A find next is implemented in it.
It caches the found entries in the text (rows, columns, starts, match lengths) and invalidate it's cache when needed. For instance: A new find pattern is given.
This also means that, unlike FindAndReplace, the functionality in this class is not thread safe.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.FindAndReplaceHelperObject.FindNext(System.String,System.String,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find the next occurance of a given find pattern. When one of the given arguments is different then the last time this function was called, the find cache is invalidated.
member.param: You can use *, +, - "" like before in Google. Multiline find patterns are not supported.
The row where a match is found.
The column where a match is found.
The start index of a find, for making text selections easier.
The length of the match

member.name: M:RandomUtils.FindAndReplaceHelperObject.FindAll(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find all occurances of a given find pattern. When one of the given arguments is different then the last time this function was called, the find cache is invalidated.
member.param: You can use *, +, - "" like before in Google. Multiline find patterns are not supported.
The rows where a match is found.
The columns where a match is found.
The start index of each find, for making text selections easier.
The lengths of the match

member.name: M:RandomUtils.FindAndReplaceHelperObject.Replace(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Always call FindNext(...) or FindAll(...) first.
member.param: True for replacing all occurances.

summary.para: Use this to create a new instance of a type using an empty public constructor and Intermediate Language. This used to be faster than Activator.CreateInstance(...),but speaking from own experience this is no longer the case with modern .Net.
However, the type's constructor is cached when calling CreateInstance, wich makes this faster when creating a lot of the same objects.
I'm not at all the inventor of this way of working, check for instance this blog post: https://codingsolution.wordpress.com/2013/07/12/activator-createinstance-is-slow/
You would use this (or Activator) when you know only a class type, e.g.
You load a custom text-based save file, if it is a custom type you can cast to an interface in the return type definition:
var compilerUnit = new CompilerUnit();
CompilerResults compilerResults = null;
Type t = null;
Assembly as = compilerUnit.Compile("<Insert code here>", debug, out compilerResults);
if (!compilerResults.Errors.HasErrors) {
t = _connectionProxyAssembly.GetType("MyNamespace.MyClass");
var obj = FastObjectCreator<IMyInterface>.CreateInstance(t);
For primitives and structs Activator is used since they cannot have an explicit parameterless constructor.

Use this to create a new instance of a type using an empty public constructor and Intermediate Language. This used to be faster than Activator.CreateInstance(...),but speaking from own experience this is no longer the case with modern .Net.
However, the type's constructor is cached when calling CreateInstance, wich makes this faster when creating a lot of the same objects.
I'm not at all the inventor of this way of working, check for instance this blog post: https://codingsolution.wordpress.com/2013/07/12/activator-createinstance-is-slow/
You would use this (or Activator) when you know only a class type, e.g.
You load a custom text-based save file, if it is a custom type you can cast to an interface in the return type definition:
var compilerUnit = new CompilerUnit();
CompilerResults compilerResults = null;
Type t = null;
Assembly as = compilerUnit.Compile("<Insert code here>", debug, out compilerResults);
if (!compilerResults.Errors.HasErrors) {
t = _connectionProxyAssembly.GetType("MyNamespace.MyClass");
var obj = FastObjectCreator<IMyInterface>.CreateInstance(t);
For primitives and structs Activator is used since they cannot have an explicit parameterless constructor.
A helper class to easily find and replace in a given piece of text. Multiline find patterns are not supported.
Use this class if you want something 'reasonably' fast and thread safe.
If you want more practical functionality for real user input, use FindAndReplaceHelperObject.

member.param: You can use *, +, - "" like before in Google. Multiline find patterns are not supported.
The rows where a match is found.
The columns where a match is found.
The start index of each find, for making text selections easier.
The lengths of the match

member.summary: Always call Find(...) first.

member.summary: Always call Find(...) first.

summary.para: A thread-safe way to cache the calling function's return value / output arguments.
This should only be used for output that always stays the same, but takes long to calculate.
You can use the instance if you want one general FunctionOutputCache.
I made this class before I knew you can do more or less the same with System.Web.Caching.Cache (HttpContext.Current.Cache).

member.name: P:RandomUtils.FunctionOutputCache.Size
member.summary: The current size of the cache.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.FunctionOutputCache.GetOrAdd(System.Reflection.MethodBase,System.Object[])

summary.para: Returns the entry if it was found in cache. Otherwise a new one is added to the cache and returned.
Store the return value and/or output arguments for the calling function in that new entry.
This is thread-safe.

member.param: e.g. MethodInfo.GetCurrentMethod()

param.name: inputArguments
param.para: Primitives, objects that are not a collection of any sort, arrays and ILists are supported. Array / IList members are compared for equality.
Override InspectArgumentEquality(object, object) if you want to for instance support dictionaries.

summary.para: Primitives, objects that are not a collection of any sort, arrays and ILists are supported. Array / IList members are compared for equality.
Override this if you want to for instance support dictionaries.

member.name: T:RandomUtils.FunctionOutputCache.CacheEntry
member.summary: Holds the MethodBase, de input and output arguments if any and the return value.

summary.para: A simple structure for representing a tree of strings (Value).
New string trees can be added as nodes of this one.
You should only have a string value at the leaf nodes.
You can use this as an Abstract Syntax Tree for your own lexing logic.

member.name: P:RandomUtils.StringTree.Value
member.summary: Preferably, you only have values for leaf nodes.

member.name: P:RandomUtils.StringTree.ChildDelimiter
member.summary: When calling ComineValues() the child delimiter is used at eache node level to combine the leaf node values.

member.name: P:RandomUtils.StringTree.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Indexer for this StringTree.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.StringTree.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)

summary.para: A simple structure for representing a tree of strings (Value).
New string trees can be added as nodes of this one.
You should only have a string value at the leaf nodes.
You can use this as an Abstract Syntax Tree for your own lexing logic.

member.param: Use combine values to return a string representation of the elements in this structure.
Set the number of child nodes.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.StringTree.CombineValues
member.summary: This combines all the leaf node values with all the child delimiters.
member.returns: If this has no childs the plain value is returned.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.StringTree.ToString
member.summary: return base.ToString() + (_childs.Length == 0 ? " value: " + _value : " count: " + _childs.Length).

member.summary: Encodes a string to a byte[] using the given encoding.

member.summary: Decodes a byte[] to a string using the given encoding.

summary.para: Converts an object to a byte[] using deflate compression.
Use gzip only for text, since it is optimized for that stuff according to wikipedia. Use deflate for everything else.
Converts an object to a byte[] using gzip compression.
Use gzip only for text, since it is optimized for that stuff according to wikipedia. Use deflate for everything else.
Converts a byte[] to an object.
Throws an exception if the array could not be deserialized or the deserialized object could not be cast to the given type.
Converts a byte[] to an object. Decompressed using deflate.
Throws an exception if the array could not be deserialized or the deserialized object could not be cast to the given type.
Converts a byte[] to an object. Decompressed using gzip.
Throws an exception if the array could not be deserialized or the deserialized object could not be cast to the given type.
Handy for stuff from the clr / interop.
Use this only for structs that contains only primitives!
Handy for stuff from the clr / interop.
Use this only for structs that contains only primitives!

member.name: M:RandomUtils.StringUtil.GenerateRandomPattern(System.String)
member.summary: generates a random word via the given pattern. 0 = 1 numeric char (obligatory) 9 = 1 numeric char (optional) A = 1 capital (obligatory) a = 1 non-capital (obligatory) B = 1 capital (optional) b = 1 non)capital (optional) # = 1 random char (obligatory) ? = 1 random char (optional) all other chars are fixed.

summary.para: A wrapper for SynchronizationContext, so SynchronizationContext is available throughout the entire application.
A SynchronizationContext is for synchronizing data to another thread, for instance to the main thread.
Handy if you want to update a System.Windows.Forms.Label from another thread. It is the most reliable way to do something like that IMHO.
Set this to System.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Current in the constructor below 'InitializeComponent();' of a WPF main form or when the handle is created for a WinForms main form.
e.g. If you want to update a System.Windows.Forms.Label form another thread: SynchronizationContextWrapper.SynchronizationContext.Current.Send((state) => { lblFoo.Text = "bar"; }, null)

member.name: T:RandomUtils.TabControlWithAdjustableBorders
member.summary: When using multiple (encapsulated) tab controls a form can look very messy. Removing borders makes the form look cleaner.

summary.para: This is a very simple time series store implementation.
It is a partioned key value store with a timestamp (DateTime) for a key and an object[] for values.
If you do not specify a partition in the different functions, the default is used.
You can use the instance if you want one general time series store.
If you want something more robust and distributed I suggest that you take a look at OpenTSDB, Redis, etc.

member.name: F:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.DEFAULTPARTITION
member.summary: The default partition. This one is used if you do not specify one in the different functions (Except ClearAll()).

member.name: P:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.Partitions
member.summary: Returns all the partition ids.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.GetInstance
member.summary: You can use the instance if you want one general time series store.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.AddOrUpdate(System.DateTime,System.Object[])
member.summary: Adds or updates a time series on the default partition.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.Remove(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Removes a time series from the default partition, if found.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.Clear
member.summary: Clears the default partition.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.Get(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns a time series from the default partition.
member.returns: If the time series was not found, null will be returned.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.AddOrUpdate(System.String,System.DateTime,System.Object[])
member.summary: Adds or updates a time series on a given partition. If the partition does not exist it will be added.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.Remove(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Removes a time series from a given partition, if found.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.Clear(System.String)
member.summary: Clears a given partition.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.ClearAll
member.summary: Clears all partitions.

member.name: M:RandomUtils.TimeSeriesStore.Get(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns a time series from the given partition.
member.returns: If the time series was not found, null will be returned.
